publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3271 Roseanna Cunningham: Deaths at Deep Cut Army Camp—That the Parliament extends sincere condolences to the family of 17-year-old Private James Collinson from Perth who was found dead from a single gunshot wound at the Princess Royal Barracks, Deep Cut, Surrey, England; further extends its condolences to the families of 20-year-old Sean Benton from Hastings, England, who was found dead on 9 June 1995 with five gunshot wounds, 18-year-old Private Cheryl James from Llangollen, Wales, who was found dead with a single bullet shot to her head in November 1995 and 17-year-old Private Geoff Gray from Hackney, London, who was found dead on 17 September 2001 with two gunshot wounds to his head; applauds the work done by the families of victims to highlight the number of serving members of Her Majesty’s Armed Forces who have lost their lives through firearms incidents on or near military premises, and supports calls for a public inquiry into the deaths at Deep Cut with a remit to hear evidence and to make recommendations concerning protection of those serving throughout the armed forces. Supported by: Andrew Wilson*, Ms Sandra White*, Kay Ullrich*, Elaine Smith*, Fiona McLeod*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Richard Lochhead*, Robert Brown*, Brian Adam*, Christine Grahame*, Mr John McAllion*, Bruce Crawford*, Phil Gallie*
